how do I write a function to accept this type of object to include any unit type?
```MyStruct{Quantity{Measurements.Measurement{Float64},ùêì,Unitful.FreeUnits{(ms,),ùêì,nothing}}}(1039.4 ¬± 6.2 ms)```

text: is there a reason to type the arguments to the function at all?

text: I am trying to make a function I have written accept this type as an input and it requires a little different handling because i have to do stuff like `v.val.val` to get the number stored in it to do thigns with it.

elements.text: I am trying to make a function I have written accept this type as an input and it requires a little different handling because i have to do stuff like
to get the number stored in it to do thigns with it.

text:
```function fast_bin(v::Union{Float64, Quantity}, bin_size::Union{Float64, Quantity})
    bin = Int64(floor(abs(v) / bin_size) + 1)
    # bin = Int64(floor(abs(v) / bin_size) + 1)
    edge = bin * bin_size
    if edge < v
        # left bin
        bin += 2
        if v > 0unit(v)
            return Bin(bin)
        else
            return Bin(-bin)
        end
    else
        bin += 1
        if v > 0unit(v)
            return Bin(bin)
        else
            return Bin(-bin)
        end
    end
end```

thats my function.. and the struct is
```struct MyStruct{T}
    val::T
end```

text: Oscars point is that you don't need to specify anything for the function arguments

elements.text: Oscars point is that you don't need to specify anything for the function arguments

text: hm, but, well, that function just doesn't work for a Quantity. You need another level of abstractions for that

elements.text: hm, but, well, that function just doesn't work for a Quantity. You need another level of abstractions for that

text:
e.g.
```extract_some_value(v::Float64) = v
extract_some_value(v::Quantity) = v.val

function fast_bin(v, bin_size)
    bin = Int64(floor(abs(extract_some_value(v)) / extract_some_value(bin_size)) + 1)
    ...```

elements.text:
extract_some_value(v::Float64) = v
extract_some_value(v::Quantity) = v.val

function fast_bin(v, bin_size)
    bin = Int64(floor(abs(extract_some_value(v)) / extract_some_value(bin_size)) + 1)
    ...

text: or you can also just make fast_bin just work with numbers and feed it `fast_bin(v.val)`
